intro: Pollichia longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed pollichia, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Pollichia longicaulis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
